title: What is the red light on the back of a smart TV? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is the TOSLINK digital audio output. It is a harmless red LED, not laser and uses a plastic, not fibre optical cable. There are inexpensive adapters on the market to convert the optical audio signal output to RCA analogue
Probably the infra-red digital optical sound output to feed a soundbar or other Hi-Fi sound system via a fibre-optic cable.
